adverbs.description: favouredly (comparative more favouredly, superlative most favouredly)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) In a favoured or favourable manner; favourably.
examples: For of fence , almost in every town , there is not only masters to teach it , with his provosters , ushers , scholars , and other names of art and school ; but there hath not failed also , which hath diligently and favouredly written it
